check_command.description: This is used to check Kubernetes components
check_command.name: component_status

check_command.description: This is used to check InfluxDB query result
check_command.name: influx_query

vars.description: URL of InfluxDB host to query
vars.name: influx_host

vars.description: Kubernetes secret name
vars.name: secret

vars.description: InfluxDB query (A). Query result will be assigned to variable (A)
vars.name: A

vars.description: InfluxDB query (B). Query result will be assigned to variable (B)
vars.name: B

vars.description: InfluxDB query (C). Query result will be assigned to variable (C)
vars.name: C

vars.description: InfluxDB query (D). Query result will be assigned to variable (D)
vars.name: D

vars.description: InfluxDB query (E). Query result will be assigned to variable (E)
vars.name: E

vars.description: Equation [A+B] to get result from queries. Result will be assigned to variable (R)
vars.name: R

vars.description: Condition for warning, compare with result. (Example: R > 75)
vars.name: warning

vars.description: Condition for critical, compare with result. (Example: R > 90)
vars.name: critical

check_command.description: This is used to check any API response parsing JSON using JQ queries
check_command.name: json_path

vars.description: URL to get data
vars.name: url

vars.description: JQ query
vars.name: query

vars.description: Kubernetes secret name
vars.name: secret

vars.description: Use InClusterConfig
vars.name: in_cluster_config

vars.description: Warning JQ query which returns [true/false]
vars.name: warning

vars.description: Critical JQ query which returns [true/false]
vars.name: critical

check_command.description: This is used to check total number of Kubernetes node
check_command.name: node_exists

vars.description: Number of expected Kubernetes Node
vars.name: count

vars.description: Selector (label query) to filter on, supports '=', '==', and '!='.
vars.name: selector

vars.description: Name of node whose existence is checked
vars.name: nodename

check_command.description: This is used to check Kubernetes Node status
check_command.name: node_status

check_command.description: This is used to check Kubernetes pod existence
check_command.name: pod_exists

vars.description: Number of expected Kubernetes Pod
vars.name: count

vars.description: Selector (label query) to filter on, supports '=', '==', and '!='.
vars.name: selector

vars.description: Name of pod whose existence is checked
vars.name: pod_name

check_command.description: This is used to check Kubernetes pod status
check_command.name: pod_status

check_command.description: This is used to check Node Disk stat.
check_command.name: node_disk

vars.description: Kubernetes secret name
vars.name: secret

vars.description: Warning level value (usage percentage defaults to 75.0)
vars.name: warning

vars.description: Critical level value (usage percentage defaults to 90.0)
vars.name: critical

check_command.description: This is used to check Pod volume stat.
check_command.name: volume

vars.description: Kubernetes secret name
vars.name: secret

vars.description: Volume name
vars.name: volume_name

vars.description: Warning level value (usage percentage defaults to 75.0)
vars.name: warning

vars.description: Critical level value (usage percentage defaults to 90.0)
vars.name: critical

check_command.description: This is used to check Kubernetes events. This plugin checks for all Warning events happened in last 'c' seconds. Icinga check_interval is provided as 'c'.
check_command.name: kube_event

vars.description: Clock skew in Duration. [Default: 30s]. This time is added with check_interval while checking events
vars.name: clock_skew

check_command.description: This is used to check Kubernetes exec command. Returns OK if exit code is zero, otherwise, returns CRITICAL
check_command.name: kube_exec

vars.description: Kubernetes container name in a pod
vars.name: container

vars.description: Exec command. [Default: '/bin/sh']
vars.name: cmd

vars.description: Exec command arguments. [Format: 'arg; arg; arg']
vars.name: argv

check_command.description: This is used to test various stuff
check_command.name: hello_icinga

check_command.description: The [check_dig](https://www.monitoring-plugins.org/doc/man/check_dig.html) plugin test the DNS service on the specified host using dig.
check_command.examples:
check_dig -H DNSSERVER -l www.example.com -A "+tcp"
 This will send a tcp query to DNSSERVER for www.example.com
check_command.name: dig

vars.description: The DNS server to query. Defaults to "127.0.0.1".
vars.name: dig_server

vars.description: Port number (default: 53).
vars.name: dig_port

vars.description: Required The address that should be looked up.
vars.name: dig_lookup

vars.description: Record type to lookup (default: A).
vars.name: dig_record_type

vars.description: An address expected to be in the answer section. If not set, uses whatever was in -l.
vars.name: dig_expected_address

vars.description: Pass STRING as argument(s) to dig.
vars.name: dig_arguments

vars.description: Number of retries passed to dig, timeout is divided by this value (Default: 3).
vars.name: dig_retries

vars.description: Response time to result in warning status (seconds).
vars.name: dig_warning

vars.description: Response time to result in critical status (seconds).
vars.name: dig_critical

vars.description: Seconds before connection times out (default: 10).
vars.name: dig_timeout

vars.description: Force dig to only use IPv4 query transport. Defaults to false.
vars.name: dig_ipv4

vars.description: Force dig to only use IPv6 query transport. Defaults to false.
vars.name: dig_ipv6

check_command.description: The [check_dns](https://www.monitoring-plugins.org/doc/man/check_dns.html) plugin uses the nslookup program to obtain the IP address for the given host/domain query. An optional DNS server to use may be specified. If no DNS server is specified, the default server(s) specified in `/etc/resolv.conf` will be used.
check_command.name: dns

vars.description: The hostname or IP to query the DNS for. Defaults to "$host_name$".
vars.name: dns_lookup

vars.description: The DNS server to query. Defaults to the server configured in the OS.
vars.name: dns_server

vars.description: The answer to look for. A hostname must end with a dot. Deprecated in 2.3
vars.name: dns_expected_answer

vars.description: The answer(s) to look for. A hostname must end with a dot. Multiple answers must be defined as array.
vars.name: dns_expected_answers

vars.description: Expect the server to send an authoritative answer.
vars.name: dns_authoritative

vars.description: Return warning if elapsed time exceeds value.
vars.name: dns_wtime

vars.description: Return critical if elapsed time exceeds value.
vars.name: dns_ctime

vars.description: Seconds before connection times out. Defaults to 10.
vars.name: dns_timeout

check_command.description: The [check_dummy](https://www.monitoring-plugins.org/doc/man/check_dummy.html) plugin will simply return the state corresponding to the numeric value of the `dummy_state` argument with optional text.
check_command.name: dummy

vars.description: The state. Can be one of 0 (ok), 1 (warning), 2 (critical) and 3 (unknown). Defaults to 0.
vars.name: dummy_state

vars.description: Plugin output. Defaults to "Check was successful.".
vars.name: dummy_text

check_command.description: The [check_icmp](https://www.monitoring-plugins.org/doc/man/check_icmp.html) plugin check_icmp allows for checking multiple hosts at once compared to `check_ping`. The main difference is that check_ping executes the system's ping(1) command and parses its output while check_icmp talks ICMP itself. check_icmp must be installed setuid root.
check_command.name: icmp

vars.description: The host's address. This can either be a single address or an array of addresses. Defaults to "$address$".
vars.name: icmp_address

vars.description: The RTA warning threshold in milliseconds. Defaults to 100.
vars.name: icmp_wrta

vars.description: The packet loss warning threshold in %. Defaults to 5.
vars.name: icmp_wpl

vars.description: The RTA critical threshold in milliseconds. Defaults to 200.
vars.name: icmp_crta

vars.description: The packet loss critical threshold in %. Defaults to 15.
vars.name: icmp_cpl

vars.description: The source IP address to send packets from.
vars.name: icmp_source

vars.description: The number of packets to send. Defaults to 5.
vars.name: icmp_packets

vars.description: The maximum packet interval. Defaults to 80 (milliseconds).
vars.name: icmp_packet_interval

vars.description: The maximum target interval.
vars.name: icmp_target_interval

vars.description: The number of hosts which have to be alive for the check to succeed.
vars.name: icmp_hosts_alive

vars.description: Payload size for each ICMP request. Defaults to 8.
vars.name: icmp_data_bytes

vars.description: The plugin timeout in seconds. Defaults to 10 (seconds).
vars.name: icmp_timeout

check_command.description: Modified check_command [http] where user can provide custom http_address
check_command.name: any_http

vars.description: The host's address. Default empty
vars.name: http_address

vars.description: The virtual host that should be sent in the "Host" header.
vars.name: http_vhost

vars.description: The request URI for GET or POST. Defaults to `/`.
vars.name: http_uri

vars.description: The TCP port. Defaults to 80 when not using SSL, 443 otherwise.
vars.name: http_port

vars.description: Whether to use SSL. Defaults to false.
vars.name: http_ssl

vars.description: Whether to force TLSv1.
vars.name: http_ssl_force_tlsv1

vars.description: Whether to force TLSv1.1.
vars.name: http_ssl_force_tlsv1_1

vars.description: Whether to force TLSv1.2.
vars.name: http_ssl_force_tlsv1_2

vars.description: Whether to force SSLv2.
vars.name: http_ssl_force_sslv2

vars.description: Whether to force SSLv3.
vars.name: http_ssl_force_sslv3

vars.description: Whether to force TLSv1 or higher.
vars.name: http_ssl_force_tlsv1_or_higher

vars.description: Whether to force TLSv1.1 or higher.
vars.name: http_ssl_force_tlsv1_1_or_higher

vars.description: Whether to force TLSv1.2 or higher.
vars.name: http_ssl_force_tlsv1_2_or_higher

vars.description: Whether to force SSLv2 or higher.
vars.name: http_ssl_force_sslv2_or_higher

vars.description: Whether to force SSLv3 or higher.
vars.name: http_ssl_force_sslv3_or_higher

vars.description: Whether to use SNI. Defaults to false.
vars.name: http_sni

vars.description: Add 'username:password' authorization pair.
vars.name: http_auth_pair

vars.description: Add 'username:password' authorization pair for proxy.
vars.name: http_proxy_auth_pair

vars.description: Don't download the body, just the headers.
vars.name: http_ignore_body

vars.description: Allow regex to span newline.
vars.name: http_linespan

vars.description: A regular expression which the body must match against. Incompatible with http_ignore_body.
vars.name: http_expect_body_regex

vars.description: A case-insensitive expression which the body must match against. Incompatible with http_ignore_body.
vars.name: http_expect_body_eregi

vars.description: Changes behaviour of http_expect_body_regex and http_expect_body_eregi to return CRITICAL if found, OK if not.
vars.name: http_invertregex

vars.description: The warning threshold.
vars.name: http_warn_time

vars.description: The critical threshold.
vars.name: http_critical_time

vars.description: Comma-delimited list of strings, at least one of them is expected in the first (status) line of the server response. Default: HTTP/1.
vars.name: http_expect

vars.description: Minimum number of days a certificate has to be valid. This parameter explicitely sets the port to 443 and ignores the URL if passed.
vars.name: http_certificate

vars.description: Name of file contains the client certificate (PEM format).
vars.name: http_clientcert

vars.description: Name of file contains the private key (PEM format).
vars.name: http_privatekey

vars.description: String to expect in the response headers.
vars.name: http_headerstring

vars.description: String to expect in the content.
vars.name: http_string

vars.description: URL encoded http POST data.
vars.name: http_post

vars.description: Set http method (for example: HEAD, OPTIONS, TRACE, PUT, DELETE).
vars.name: http_method

vars.description: Warn if document is more than seconds old.
vars.name: http_maxage

vars.description: Specify Content-Type header when POSTing.
vars.name: http_contenttype

vars.description: String to be sent in http header as User Agent.
vars.name: http_useragent

vars.description: Any other tags to be sent in http header.
vars.name: http_header

vars.description: Print additional perfdata. Defaults to false.
vars.name: http_extendedperfdata

vars.description: How to handle redirect pages. Possible values: "ok" (default), "warning", "critical", "follow", "sticky" (like follow but stick to address), "stickyport" (like sticky but also to port)
vars.name: http_onredirect

vars.description: Minimum page size required:Maximum page size required.
vars.name: http_pagesize

vars.description: Seconds before connection times out.
vars.name: http_timeout

vars.description: Use IPv4 connection. Defaults to false.
vars.name: http_ipv4

vars.description: Use IPv6 connection. Defaults to false.
vars.name: http_ipv6
